page.title: 06Wave Reflection Wall
page.content: The Wave Reflection Wall was built in Morecambe between 1982 and 1984. There had been a succession of floods over the years causing a considerable amount of damage. The last floods occured in 1983 and 1977. The floods were caused by a coming together of high winds, high seas and heavy rain and resulted in low lying areas up to a mile from the sea front being flooded. During the last flood huge chunks of the promenade wall were gouged out, shelters were destroyed and fishing boats damaged or destroyed. One boat was flung right across the promenade giving overwhelming evidence of the power of nature. After the 1977 flood the decision was made to build a new sea wall. The idea and design for the wave reflection wall came from the city engineer Mr. Norman Shadwell.
